overview: If you're aged 19 or over, on a further education course and facing financial hardship, Discretionary Learner Support (DLS) could help with learning costs - who qualifies and how to apply
title: Discretionary Learner Support

table.body:
If you're aged 19 or over, on a further education course and facing financial hardship, you could get Discretionary Learner Support (DLS) to help with costs. 

What you get depends on your circumstances. DLS can be used to help pay for:

* childcare (if you're 20 or over - if you're 19, apply for [Care to Learn](/care-to-learn "Care to Learn") instead)
* accommodation and travel
* course materials and equipment 
* other hardship needs


*[DLS]: Discretionary Learner Support
table.title: Overview

table.body:
Your learning provider decides if you get funding and how much you get - this depends on their scheme and your circumstances. 

##How you're paid

This depends on your college's scheme and what it's being used for. You could get funding as:

- a direct payment to you, which you don't have to pay back
- a payment to someone else, like a landlord
- a loan, which you have to pay back
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
To get Discretionary Learner Support (DLS) you must be:

- 19 or over
- studying at a learning provider funded by the Skills Funding Agency (check with your college)

^If you're applying to get help with childcare costs you need to be 20 or over - if you're 19, apply for [Care to Learn](/care-to-learn "Care to Learn") instead.^

You can claim if you also get other grants and funds, including:

- [Professional and Career Development Loans](/career-development-loans "Career Development Loans")
- [Care to Learn](/care-to-learn "Care to Learn") (although you can't get DLS for childcare costs)
- New Deal for Lone Parents
- [Disability Living Allowance](/dla-disability-living-allowance-benefit "Disability Living Allowance")

You **can't** claim if you're:

- getting full [student finance](/apply-for-student-finance-2012-13 "Apply for student finance 2012/13") for higher education 
- on a [learndirect](http://learndirect.co.uk/?CMP=ps_brand&gclid=CMq1z9TMrqwCFcMOfAodDXruHAm/ "learndirect"){:rel="external"} course
- on a New Deal programme (except New Deal for Lone Parents) 
- on an [apprenticeship](/apprenticeships "apprenticeships") training scheme
- on a work-based learning course
- on an Adult & Community Learning course 
- an asylum seeker aged over 19 

##Other financial help

Find out whether you qualify for other types of funding from:

- student support staff at your college 
- [the National Careers Service](https://nationalcareersservice.direct.gov.uk/aboutus/contactus/Pages/adviser.aspx "Send a message to a National Careers Service adviser"){:rel="external"} 

*[DLS]: Discretionary Learner Support
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
Apply directly to your learning provider - each has its own application process. 

Speak to your student support services to find out what's available and for help with applying.

##Appeal a decision

Contact your learning provider for information on how to do this.
table.title: How to claim
